bibl.title: Letter from Walter M. Simpson to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1941

div1.p: Simpson sends Hench a print made from a framed picture. He offers to bring the original with him when he sees Hench next, as he believes it might be useful for Hench's Walter Reed collection.

div1.head: Letter from Walter M. Simpson to Philip Showalter Hench, May 21, 1941
div1.opener:
KETTERING INSTITUTE FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH
THE MIAMI VALLEY HOSPITAL
DAYTON, OHIO
May 21, 1941
WALTER M. SIMPSON, M.D., F.A.C.P., DIRECTOR
H. WORLEY KENDELL, M.D., ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR
DONALD L. ROSE, M.D., RESEARCH ASSOCIATE
Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Phil:
div1.p:
Here is a very poor print made from the framed picture, the original
of which measures about 13 x 9 inches. It will at least give you an idea
about the picture that we talked about in WashingtonBoston. If you do not have
this picture for your Walter Reed collection, let me know and I will bring
it with me when I come up to talk at the Minnesota State Medical Society
meeting this week-end. I will probably be able to spend a few hours with
Virg and Gladys Counseller on Saturday evening and part of Sunday. I will
leave here by plane for Rochester Saturday morning, the twenty-fourth.

You were so sure that I was going to forget this little stint that
you told me you would write me about it. Now how do you feel?

June and the kiddies are well and happy and all of us send affectionate
greetings from House to House.
div1.closer:
Always yours, Walter M. Simpson, M. D. WMS/B

247 Blossom Heath
